comments:
Build ID: 3,3RC4

Steps To Reproduce:
Latest generate GMF N180607 build generates code which does not work with my model. Either on opening old diagrams or an initialising new diagrams I get

Models validate correctly. It might be related to bug 193178 and other recent bugs with labels on links, but non describes my problem and I intentionally tried the latest nightly build. RC3 does not work either.

More information:
I feel that at least this bug and bug #193186 are due to gmfgraph migration/changes.

Yes, this is also my guess. I used the "Migrate to GMF2 Action..." in the Popup-Menu to migrate the models from my GMF2 M7 models. It prompted me to do so.
The models are attached to Bug https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=193178 which might also be part of the whole issue

A bit of debugging makes me wonder whether this is a draw2d bug instead of a GMF one. in org.eclipse.draw2d.Polyline.addPoint:48 the points vector is null, I don't understand how this could actually happen as points is created as initialised variable. All this happens because my link has an arrow head as in the mindmap tutorial. And adding the template points to the arrow head decoration fails because of the null collection.
One final note, as soon as you remove the PolylineDecoration code in createContents() everything works as expected.

The problem originates in the gmfgraph model where i had the polyline decoration as child of the polyline. As soon as I moved the polyline up to be a child of the figure gallery it works. Hence, the should be a constraint checking that such a model is not valid?

(In reply to comment #6)
You are right, the actual reason is that unlike GMF M7 (and earlier releases) we do generate code for Link's children (in fact, to handle legacy models that has link labels defined as children of link despite the fact link labels are 'external' and should not be defined as link's children). Your models have decoration figures as link children but generator doesn't expect to see decorations as children and processes them as mere polylines/polygons, what eventaully leass to Polyline.points == null.

The fix you made (moving your link decorations (defined as link's children) into
FigureGallery) is right way to workaround the issue. However, there should be no such limitation (not constraint to warn), and we'd rather fix template.

(In reply to comment #7)
Children to links were introduced with bug #191273. Proposed fix restricts link child generation to labels only, so that outcome of bug #191273 persists and no decoration (or any other unexpected child figure of a link) gets generated.
